presentation.title: Decentralized certification platform
presentation.description: The Badge is a decentralized certification platform powered by Ethereum. It provides users with the opportunity to tokenize any piece of information from the real world in the form of badges. These badges are verified and validated by the community, which decides what should be accepted and what should not be.

whatIsTheBadge.title: WHAT IS THE BADGE
whatIsTheBadge.stepOne: A platform that certifies information in a decentralized way.
whatIsTheBadge.stepTwo: Generates certifications (badges) based on evidence provided.
whatIsTheBadge.stepThree: Each badge will require evidence for being issued.
whatIsTheBadge.stepFour: Curators will be rewarded for auditing and flagging fraudulent badges.

why.title: Why we need decentralized certifications
why.description: To ensure our initiatives to bring more people into the crypto world are fruitful, we need a dependable ecosystem. To create a decentralized future, accurate information is essential. If we entrust all the duty of verification only to centralized entities, the ecosystem will continue to be plagued by the actions of bad actors.

whatAreCurators.title: What are curators
whatAreCurators.description: TheBadge curators are members of TheBadge's decentralized community who verify the authenticity of certifications. They carefully review the evidence provided for each badge and can raise challenges if they detect any irregularities. If the curators successfully expose a fraudulent badge, they will be rewarded for their efforts.

steps.title: 1. Integrity of The Badge
steps.description: Providing incentives for curators to review the evidence and raise challenges when necessary carefully, helps to ensure that only deserving candidates receive badges and protects the reputation and integrity of the certifications.

steps.title: 2. Badge request
steps.description: Whenever a badge request is submitted, the curators will be notified and given a certain amount of time to review the evidence provided.

steps.title: 3. Curator's task
steps.description: They will be rewarded by detecting fraudulent evidence on badges, incentivized by receiving BADGE tokens for that.

steps.title: 4. Initiating a challenge
steps.description: If a curator has doubts about the authenticity of the evidence, it can initiate a challenge by making a deposit of money. This will start an arbitration process, in which a jury will review the evidence and determine whether the curator  or the badge requester is correct.

steps.title: 5. Rewards
steps.description: After the arbitration process is completed, if the jury denies the badge evidence, the curator will receive part of the deposit of the badge requester and a reward in BADGE tokens.

community.title: Community Badges
community.description: Represent real-world information in the form of blockchain-based certifications. To obtain a badge, users must provide evidence and pass through TheBadge's curation process, where our community of curators will review and verify the authenticity of the evidence.

steps.title: 1. Empowering the communities
steps.description: Certify their real-world information on a decentralized way, for example a web3 company can apply to get a proof of reserve certification. People from the community can then always verify that this process is transparent.

steps.title: 2. Choosing a certificate
steps.description: The user selects the badge they are interested in obtaining. Each badge type will require the submission of specific proof or evidence to certify that you have the right to claim it

steps.title: 3. Providing the evidence
steps.description: Each badge type will have specific requirements for the evidence that must be submitted in order to claim the badge. An example of this type of badge could be the verification of a course completion certificate.

steps.title: 4. Making the deposit
steps.description: A deposit is requested to initiate the process. It's needed to avoid fraudulent usages of the platform and ensures that badge applicants are serious about obtaining the badge. The deposit will be returned at the end of the process if the evidence provided it's authentic.

steps.title: 5. Curation process start
steps.description: Wait for our community of curators to review the evidence provided. They will carefully review it and could raise challenges if they have any doubts or concerns.

steps.title: 5a. Badge approval
steps.description: If the user submission passes the curation process, the badge will be granted to the user's address.

steps.title: 5b. Challenge starts
steps.description: In case that a curator challenged the submission, a decentralized jury will analyse the case and determine wether the evidence is authentic or not.

steps.title: 5b-1. Challenge denied
steps.description: The jury determines that the evidence is veridic. The user recovers his guarantee deposit and the badge is granted to it's address.

steps.title: 5b-2. Challenge denied
steps.description: The jury determines that the evidence is fraudulent. The badge is not granted and the user losses it's guarantee deposit, which will be given to the challenger.

third-party.title: Third-party Badges
third-party.description: Also known as "Blockchain certifications as a service". They are badges generated and backed by a public or private entity. Entities that are willing to generate these badge have to be registered on the platform before they can start emitting them.

steps.title: 1. The Badge as a tool
steps.description: Entities can use The Badge to become third-party badge creators, by doing that, they will be able to grant certifications on their own behalf

steps.title: 2. Becoming a third-party
steps.description: First the entity has to register within the platform submitting information such as name, description, logo, etc.

steps.title: 3. Start creating
steps.description: Once the entity is registered, it can start creating their own badges. These badges can be then claimed by addresses chosen by the entity.

steps.title: 4. Being verified
steps.description: The entity can apply to become a verified issuer on The Badge. This will allow a more personalized and secure way of issuing badges.

steps.title: 5. Start emitting
steps.description: Once the entityâ€™s been verified, it will be able to emit badges directly to addresses of members of their community.

whatAreCreators.title: What are creators
whatAreCreators.description: As a badge creator on TheBadge's platform, you can design and publish custom badges that other users can apply for to verify real-world information. Set the price for the badges you create and receive a share of the fee when users apply for and receive them.

steps.title: 1. Bringing your know-how on-chain
steps.description: Users can become a badge creator, for example, a notary knows how to verify a document needed in a compliance process on a specific country, by using TheBadge, they could use that knowledge on the Blockchain.

steps.title: 2. Creating new badges
steps.description: To earn money by creating a badge, the creator will need to define the information and evidence that a badge requester will need to provide.

steps.title: 3. Setting a price
steps.description: The creator can set a price for the badge. This will be the amount needed to be paid in order to request the badge.

steps.title: 4. Being rewarded
steps.description: When users request the badge type and pay the price, The Badge will split that fee between the platform and the creator for every badge issued, with the creator taking the big share of it.
